data.title: Best Breakfast in Town
data.text: I'm a local and often visit Ambition for breakfast on a Sunday morning. It's cool place with a nice atmosphere and friendly service. I highly recommend the blueberry pancakes. Oh, and the coffee is always great. It can get crowded on Sunday morning so it might be best to get there by 10:30. If not, you might have to wait a few minutes for a table but it will be worth it.

data.title: Good tasting food.
data.text: Stopped by early evening dinner.  Great black bean burger and unique salad with quinoa and hummus on top. Service was  friendly and quick.  Attentive to those going to a show.

data.title: Great breakfast and brunch place
data.text: Marc has a gem of a small intimate cafe and the vibe is very low key and comfortable.  nestled on pedestrian Jay Street just across the street from Proctors Theatre, it is a great place to nosh before a concert, play, etc @ Proctor's.   The brunches on Sunday are well balanced for meat eaters and vegetarians and vegans as well.  The coffee and tea selection are exceptional, with the standard sodas available.  If you are in the "Electric City" and want to have a quick treat, this is the place.

data.title: Great breakfast spot
data.text: Nice stop for quick breakfast, friendly staff very decent prices. On a nice strip with shops. Convenient location.

data.title: An aesthetic all its own
data.text:
We struggled to find Ambition - my GPS didn't correctly place it, and Jay St seems to have changed shape over the past few years. When we arrived, we found a table at the back and soaked in the mixture of aged American building and Hollywood nostalgia. We were amused as patron after patron struggled to find the restrooms located behind us as their movie-character signs didn't convey the true purpose of the rooms. 

We had lunch and the food was well-prepared, but modest in terms of portion size (despite the waitress describing the sandwiches as filling). The service was friendly and helpful.

data.title: Funky little coffee and lunch spot!
data.text: Ambition is a great little place to grab lunch or coffee. The decor is eclectic with a lot to look at. The menu is mostly sandwiches and salads, many unique food combos and fun names. Service is friendly and the food is always good, as is the coffee. I've been there for lunch and coffee many times, sometimes with friends and sometimes with my college age daughter. I understand they are also open evenings and have a bar for the Proctors theatre crowd. Try it, you'll like it!

data.title: WE love Ambition.
data.text: This is a grewat place to grab a bite before Proctors performance , movie or other downtown Schenectady events. Friendly place with good food and drinks and coffee. You might run into an actor or two from Proctors!

data.title: Ecelctic decor, friendly staff, minimal dinner offerings
data.text: Loved the funky retro-80s cafe vibe, but were expecting something a little more substantive for dinner. Soup, sandwhiches and salads only. Food was good enough, but I expect brunch, lunch and coffee is where they excel, as well as a unique and wonderful atmosphere.

data.title: SURPRISED IN THE ALLEY
data.text:
We wander on Sunday mornings, often to the Farmers Market, in downtown Schenectady and while walking down an alley which connects to Broadway spotted an eclectic Bistro.The atmosphere reminds me of Hippie hangouts from 1960.The staff are competent young persons and keep very busy with the constant flow of customers looking for coffee to go or sit down service with a varied menu of eggs, waffles and omelets.Each are customized by the cooks to their variation of the day.
  The food is competent and fun and suites the casual atmosphere.People watching is a part of their charm.

data.title: The Best Little Coffee Shop With Panache
data.text: You can always count on Marc to serve a fantastic breakfast with the best coffee in town, a delicious lunch with something for everyone including vegetarians and he has the perfect place to go for an elegant dinner before the theatre at Proctors.

data.title: always a happy customer
data.text: I've been to ambitions for breakfast, coffee break, and lunch during the green market on Sunday's.  The service is always professional, prompt and friendly.  The food and drinks always meet my expectations.  It's a fun little atmosphere.

data.title: Tasty brunch
data.text: We stopped here for brunch on Sunday at the recommendation of the hotel clerk and were not disappointed. As others have said, it is a funky little place, but they have a decent amount of seating and the staff was quite friendly. The menu is varied enough with breakfast specialties, but also more lunch type sandwiches, if that's what you are feeling. And of course no brunch is complete without bloody mary's or mimosas! In any case, I went for Jeremy's package, which was a turkey, apple, tomato, bacon, cheddar, cranberry pesto, balsamic concoction on pretzel bread. It was quite good and came with round tortilla chips, which I thought was a bit odd compared to regular chips, but it worked okay. My husband had a build your own eggs sandwich with cheese, and the rest of the table had the square start of eggs with homefries and toast and the baba wawa english muffin with egg, cheddar, avocado, bacon and homefries. No complaints on any of our meals, they were good and decently priced. We would go there again and bonus points that it happens to be close by to where the farmer's market was going on.

data.title: Never had a bad meal here!
data.text: Love the quirky setting and the good times shared there.  Favorite sandwich is the Turkey Avocado sandwich.

data.title: Funky, fun, and good food
data.text: This is a locals' favorite and a good place to take visitors when introducing the city.  Just down the street from The Open Door Bookstore, another treasure.  Try the crab cakes.

data.title: Ab Fab Late Lunch!
data.text: Late lunch including a small salad (bountiful) and a crab cake sandwich (fabulous). The owner was working the grill. Two young folks at the front of the house gave us Schenectady suggestions (our first visit). The bistro is literally located on a Diagon Alley look alike. Great place!

data.title: Great breakfast and lunch bistro
data.text: Schenectady is an old city with lots of great eateries. Ambition is one of them. They have booths in a cafe with old and new posters of performers  at Proctor's Theatre as decor along with a shabby old coffee hangout vibe. They also have tables in a step up room with gelato available. Just a different place with a varied menu of sandwiches and breakfasts. I like the feel of Ambition, plus their coffee. Go, you will enjoy the food. Just don't be a germaphobe because everything is deliberately old and used looking, i.e. Vintage. The food is great and never bad, at least in my experience!

data.title: Great Food and  Old Fashion Experience
data.text: The homemade soups are excellent and the sandwhiches are piled high and delicious. Limited desserts are available, standard drinks offered.  The atmosphere is really old fashion and Parking could be a problem unless your in the Proctors Parking garage and walk across the street.

data.title: Great little bistro
data.text: Stopped in for dinner before a show recently at Proctor's. They are only open for dinner when there's a main stage show. Awesome eggplant part, which was the special from the owners Mom's recipe. It was light and delicious! A very nice salad and bread, and shared a very nice bottle of a red blend.

user_location.name: Clifton Park, New York, United States

data.title: Lunch at Ambition
data.text: This place is great, I know the owners. Within walking distance of many places including the Amtrak Satation etc.

data.title: Really tasty soups, sandwiches, salads at a decent price - on pedestrian Jay Street
data.text: I just got back from a lovely lunch at Ambition, a Schenectady favorite within easy walking distance of Proctor's, Schenectady Light Opera, the YMCA, City Hall, and many other places. The restaurant was not busy so we had terrific service. There were two soup choices, cream of mushroom and salmon chowder. My friend and I each had a bowl of the chowder ($4.50) which was beautifully spiced, full of chunks of salmon and potato,mark and perfect for a chilly, clammy day. My hot hibiscus tea ($2.50) was great, and the waitress offered a refill of hot water at just the right moment. There's a great selection of sandwiches, several of which I've had before, but I opted for the "grapes and goat (cheese) salad ($9.00), which was huge and delightfully full of yummy salad stuff. Ambition has funky interior decoration which is always entertaining to first-time guests. I highly recommend this spot, especially for its good selection of lunch choices.
